availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Scholl (Powell County Circuit Court Clerk and Stanton Postmaster)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky Circuit Court Clerk and Stanton Postmaster. Kentucky native. Married Talitha Scholl. Father of Betty A. Scholl. Powell County Circuit Court Clerk from c1858 to 1867. Postmaster of Stanton, Kentucky from 1864 to 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 76. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 22. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 1, Subdivision 144, p. 10. Thomas S. Page, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859 (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1860), p. 291. Grant Green, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861 (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1862), p. 306. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1866), p. 12. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1867 (Frankfort, KY: John H. Harney, 1867), p. 356. Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, volume 28, Kentucky, Powell County, Stanton, p. 108, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Washington, D.C., National Archives. “James H Scholl (1817-1891),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 5376038, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=SCH&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=4801&GRid=5376038& (accessed June 11, 2017).
